result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 08:34 AM Court appears via video from Bayfield County. Defendant Adam W. Vice appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Aaron Marcoux appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin appeared by phone means for Defendant Adam W. Vice. Court calls case and appearances. Status from the State re: special prosecutor status. Brief argument from Atty Perrin. Atty Perrin moves the court to dismiss the case due to failure to prosecute. Response from the State. Victim rights have been complied with. Based on the record the court finds the case is dismissed w/out prejudice.

Defendant, Adam W. Vice appeared with Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin.  Attorney Angeline E Winton appeared for the State. Court calls case and appearances.  On record at 9:50am. Court speaks to parties re: motions.  State speaks to the court. Atty Perrin speaks to the court.  State calls Lisa Dorn to the stand. Clerk swears Ms. Dorn.  State begins questioning.  Objection by Atty Perrin-Overruled. State continues.  Nothing further. Cross from Atty Perrin. Nothing further. Redirect. Nothing further. Witness excused.  Arugment from the parties. Court makes ruling.  State speaks re: other motions. Atty Perrin makes statement. Off record at 11:20-Back on record at 11:45. State speaks to the court re: motion to surpress. Atty Perrin makes statement. State makes argument that Miranda-style notice is not an isue at this point as it has gone through Court of Appeals. Court questions counsel re: break or figure out now to see if the Miranda-Style notice was part of the polygraph as opposed to the second interview. Atty Perrin makes statment-argument. Court makes statement. Counsel to provide briefs. Arguments.  Briefs to be filed by 7/27, reply by 08/10-Bail will continie. 12:39 adjourned.  Oral ruling scheduled for September 14, 2018 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 23, 2019 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2019 at 08:30 am.
